assignments.description: Assign the previously entered new "Quantity Consumed" to the record variable of the Data Table prior updating the record.
assignments.name: Assign_NewQuantity_ProductsConsumed_Record
assignments.label: Assign Quantity to Products Consumed Record

assignments.description: If the Work Order triggering this Flow is a "Child Work Order" then populate the flow record variable with the below-specified values. The difference on Children is the lacking field for "WorkOrderLineItemId" and the "Work Order Number" being taken from the Get Element "Work Order Details" in order to show the Column "Part added to" correctly.
assignments.name: Assign_ProductConsumed_FieldValues_Child
assignments.label: Assign Product Consumed Field Values - Child

assignments.description: If the Work Order triggering this Flow is a "Parent Work Order" then populate the flow record variable with the below specified values.
assignments.name: Assign_ProductConsumed_FieldValues_Parent
assignments.label: Assign Product Consumed Field Values - Parent

assignments.description: This Assignment Element is used to add the user's selection from the previous screen from the Products Consumed Record Variable to the Products Consumed Record Collection variable.
assignments.name: Assign_ProductConsumed_Record_to_Collection
assignments.label: Assign Product Consumed Record to Collection

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddMoreParts
choices.choiceText: I'd like to add more parts

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddParts

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AmendParts

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_CreateProductConsumedRecords
choices.choiceText: I'm finished - add the above parts

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_Finished

decisions.description: This decision element is used to determine the users choice on the previous screen whether "Add additional parts" or "Adjust consumed parts" has been selected in the radio button choice element.
decisions.name: Decision_AddAdjustParts
decisions.label: Add or adjust parts?

rules.name: Outcome_AdjustParts_NoSelection
rules.label: Adjust consumed parts - no selection made

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the radio buttons in the last screen. Depending if the user chose "Add more parts" or "I'm finished - create the above parts" this decision will take the user back to the "Select Product Items" screen again or go to the last step and create the new Products Consume records.
decisions.name: Decision_AddMoreParts
decisions.label: Add more parts?

decisions.description: This Element is used as a validation to prevent users to open this feature prematurely when the Work Order is still in an "in progress" state (= Service Appointments still open) or Work Order already in a "Closed" state. (=Status completed or cannot complete/cancel)
decisions.name: Decision_Check_WorkOrder_Status
decisions.label: Check Work Order Status

decisions.description: Determine if the Work Order record triggering this flow is a "Parent" (= highest hierarchy, field "ParentWorkOrderID" on Work Order Record is blank) or a Child Work Order related to another Parent Work Order. Depending on the Outcome, assign variables accordingly.
decisions.name: Decision_ParentWorkOrder_or_ChildWorkOrder
decisions.label: Parent Work Order or Child Work Order?

decisions.description: This decision element is used to validate the previously entered value for "Quantity Consumed", as a zero or a negative value would fail in the Update Records element.
decisions.name: Decision_Validate_Entered_QuantityConsumed
decisions.label: Validate Entered Quantity Consumed

Flow.description:
26/01/2023 - V1-3: Initial Versions. See https://watercarestp.atlassian.net/browse/MSRS-138 for details
27/01/2023 - V4: Add decision element and logic to differentiate Parent Work Orders (with WOLIs) and Child Work Orders (without WOLIs) to make flow universally usable on Parent or Child Work Orders.
31/01/2023 - V5: Add logic to handle the "Adjust consumed parts" radio button choice on the first screen element of this flow including logic and error screens to differentiate negative or zero values entered by the user.
31/01/2023 - V6/V7: Add logic to prevent users from adjusting existing Product Consumed records with values higher than the "Quantity on Hand" on the truck where the part has been consumed from before.
01/02/2023 - V8: Cleanup not required variables an elements; Add descriptions to every element;
02/02/2023 - V9: Added an additional criteria into the "Get all Consumed Products" element to prevent "Labour" parts from being shown in the Datatable of the screen "Used Parts Overview"
05/02/2023 - V10/11: Added an additional radio button choice option to the first "Overview" screen that gives the user the option to finish the flow without adjusting or adding parts. This became required after opening this flow as a sub-flow from "Work Complete Review" and experiencing a condition where it was not possible to exit out of the sub-flow after only adjusting parts.
06/02/2023 - V12: Remove visual path on flow after experiencing interference when the flow is opened as sub-flow from the "Work Complete Review" parent flow.
10/02/2023 - V13: In the screen "Overview" swapped the column "EAM WO Number" against "Work Type"in the Parts Data Table as requested by the business stakeholders.
14/02/2023 - V14: Added a Validation Decision Element "Work Order Status" and Error Screen in to prevent users from opening the "Add or Adjust Parts" functionality when the Work Order is already in a completed state. Add Fault Lines and Error Screens to all crucial pink data elements.
15/02/2023 - V15: Hotfix for Validation logic firing incorrectly on all statuses but Completed, Rejected, Canceled

dynamicChoiceSets.description: This choice set is used in an "Choice Lookup" element on the screen "Select Truck & WOLI" and holds all possible (Van-) Locations to choose from for the user. It is populated from the Get Element "Get All Van Locations".
dynamicChoiceSets.name: ChoiceSet_VanLocations

Flow.label: MSN - Products Consumed - Add additional Parts - Screen Flow

loops.description: This element is used to loop over all parts that have been selected by the user on the previous screen.
loops.name: Loop_PartsToAdjust
loops.label: Loop over Parts to adjust

recordCreates.description: This element creates all "Products Consumed" records that have been added to the collection variable from the user's selection on the previous screens.
recordCreates.name: Create_Records_from_Collection
recordCreates.label: Create Records from Collection

recordDeletes.description: Delete the previously selected "Products Consumed" (=Part) record in order to send a Quantity Consumed value of 0 to EAM. Please note: this is required as Salesforce does not allow the value "0" on Products Consumed records in the field "Quantity Consumed".
recordDeletes.name: Delete_ProductsConsumed_Record
recordDeletes.label: Delete Selected Products Consumed Record

recordLookups.description: Attempt to retrieve all Work Order Line Items that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow. This is required as Parts always have to be consumed against a Child Work Order in EAM and in a subsequent step, the user will have to choose a WOLI accordingly. If the variable is blank (=no WOLIs exist) the triggering record usually is a Child Work Order and parts can be consumed directly against the Work Order itself. Hence the screen element will not show WOLIs to select from in this case.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Child_Work_Order_Line_Items
recordLookups.label: Get all Child Work Order Line Items

recordLookups.description: Get all "Products Consumed" records that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow. This will be used to show a list of already consumed parts to the user on the next screen element.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Consumed_Products
recordLookups.label: Get all Consumed Products

recordLookups.description: Retrieve all available (Van-) "Locations" that are candidates to consume parts from later in the process. This is required in a subsequent step, where users have to specify which Van they want to use to consume parts from, and retrieving all available "Product Items" (=parts) on that van for the user to select from.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Van_Locations
recordLookups.label: Get all Van Locations

recordLookups.description: Retrieve record details from the Work Order that was triggering the flow. This will be used in subsequent steps to populate information in Screen elements.
recordLookups.name: Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details
recordLookups.label: Get Current Work Order Details

recordLookups.description: Get all "Product Item" records that are related to the (Van-) Location selected on the previous screen.. This will be used to show a list of available Product Items (=parts) to the user on the next screen element.
recordLookups.name: Get_Product_Items_for_selected_Location
recordLookups.label: Get Product Items for selected Location

recordLookups.description: This get element is used to retrieve the "Quantity on Hand" on the Van from which the selected part originally was consumed from. This then is used as a validation to prevent users from increasing the quantity to a value higher than the quantity on hand on the truck.
recordLookups.name: Get_QuantityOnHand_for_ProductItem
recordLookups.label: Get Quantity on Hand for selected Product Item

recordUpdates.description: Update the previously selected "Products Consumed" (=Part) record with new values entered by the user.
recordUpdates.name: Update_ProductConsumed_Record
recordUpdates.label: Update Selected Product Consumed Record

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user adjust the selected part from the previous screen and make adjustments
screens.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart
screens.label: Adjust selected part

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_Subheading_ProductOverview
fields.fieldText:
﻿

You are going to adjust: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.ProductName}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_ProductDetailsSubheader
fields.fieldText: Product Details:

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_ProductName
fields.fieldText: Product: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.ProductName}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_FromLocation
fields.fieldText: Consumed from truck: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.MSN_Consumed_From_Location__c}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_CurrentQuantityConsumed
fields.fieldText: Quantity currently consumed: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.QuantityConsumed}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_LinkedTo_Subheader
fields.fieldText: Linked to:

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_ProductItemNumber
fields.fieldText: Product Item: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.ProductItem.ProductItemNumber}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_WorkOrderNumber
fields.fieldText: Work Order: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.WorkOrder.WorkOrderNumber}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_WOLINumber
fields.fieldText: Work Order Line Item: {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.WorkOrderLineItem.LineItemNumber}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_Subheading_PartsAdjustment
fields.fieldText: Please enter the adjusted quantity:

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_QuantityOnHand
fields.fieldText: Quantity available on {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.MSN_Consumed_From_Location__c}: {!Get_QuantityOnHand_for_ProductItem.QuantityOnHand}

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_NewQuantityConsumed
fields.fieldText: New total Quantity Consumed
fields.helpText:
Instructions:


  1. Please enter the new quantity consumed without decimals.
  2. Negative values are not allowed.
  3. You can only add as many parts as are available on the truck the part has been consumed from initially (otherwise please add a part from a different van in the previous step)

Examples:

  • If you want to increase the quantity from 3 to 4 in total: enter 4.
  • If you want to decrease the quantity from 2 to 1: enter 1.
  • If you want to remove the part and revert the consumption: enter the value "0". Note: you will have to confirm this on an additional screen, as the "Parts & Labour" record in Salesforce is going to be deleted in this case and the full quantity returned in EAM accordingly.

validationRule.errorMessage: "New Quantity Consumed" cannot be higher than the total of the "Quantity currently consumed" and the "Quantity available on the truck".

screens.description: This Screen is used as an error screen should the user attempt to set the "Quantity Consumed" to a negative value as this is unsupported by EAM in the payload.
screens.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_NegativeQuantity
screens.label: Quantity Consumed is Negative
screens.backButtonLabel: Go back to the previous screen

value.stringValue: Negative values not allowed in EAM

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_NegativeQuantity_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
Error: "Quantity Consumed" cannot be negative for part {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.ProductName}.


We cannot continue, as EAM does not accept negative values being sent back in an update. In case the product has been consumed in error, please set the value to "0" on the previous screen. This will then delete the record in Salesforce and send an appropriate update to EAM.


Please use the "Go back to the previous screen" button and change your entry.

screens.description: This Screen is used as a confirmation screen should the user attempt to set the value for "Quantity Consumed" to "0" as this requires the record to be deleted instead of updated as of validation restrictions within Salesforce.
screens.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_ZeroQuantityConfirmation
screens.label: Quantity Consumed is Zero
screens.backButtonLabel: Go back to the previous screen

value.stringValue: Please confirm your entry or go back to the previous screen

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedPart_ZeroQuantity_ConfirmationMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Warning! It looks like you want to set the "Quantity Consumed" for the part {!ProductsConsumedDataTable.firstSelectedRow.ProductName} to 0.


We can continue, however, be aware that this will:


  1. Delete the record in Salesforce (Salesforce does not allow 0)
  2. Update the quantity consumed on this part in EAM to 0.


Would you like to continue and delete the parts record?

screens.description: This Screen is used as a confirmation screen should the user attempt to set the value for "Quantity Consumed" to "0" as this requires the record to be deleted instead of updated as of validation restrictions within Salesforce.
screens.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedParts_NoSelection
screens.label: No part selected
screens.backButtonLabel: Go back to the previous screen

value.stringValue: Error! No part for adjustment selected.
You didn't select a part to adjust on the previous screen

fields.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedParts_NoSelection_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Error! It looks like you did not select a part on the previous screen.


In order to make adjustments to a part, you first need to select a part in the table on the previous screen.


Please use the "Go back to the previous screen" button and make your selection.

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to create new "Products Consumed" records.
screens.name: Screen_Create_ProductsConsumed_Error
screens.label: Create Products Consumed - Error

fields.name: Screen_Create_ProductsConsumed_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Awww, snap! I could not add the selected additional parts for you.

fields.name: Screen_Create_ProductsConsumed_ErrorDetails
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not add the new parts you selected on the previous screen. If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to consume products from the selected van
  • You don't have the required access rights to create new "Parts & Labour" records
  • The quantity of the product you selected is not available

﻿

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to delete the selected "Products Consumed" record.
screens.name: Screen_Delete_ProductsConsumed_Error
screens.label: Delete Products Consumed - Error

value.stringValue: Error: Cannot delete the selected part

fields.name: Screen_Delete_ProductsConsumed_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Awww, snap! I could not delete the selected part for you.

fields.name: Screen_Delete_ProductsConsumed_ErrorDetails
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not delete the part you selected on the previous screen. If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to delete "Parts & Labour" records
  • The integration of Parts returns to EAM failed

﻿

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen is used as an entry screen when the user opens this flow and shows a list of all currently already consumed products on the Work Order that triggered this flow and on any WOLIs thereunder in case it is a Parent Work Order. From here the user can decide to either "Add additional parts" or "Adjust consumed parts" by making a selection in the table.
screens.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview
screens.label: Used Parts Overview

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_Heading_PartsUsed
fields.fieldText: 1. The following parts have been used on this job

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_Heading_Action
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to give the user "Checkout Summary" which gives them the opportunity to double-check their entries again, prior to creating the selected Products Consumed records in the next and final step.
screens.name: Screen_ProductsConsumed_CheckoutSummary
screens.label: Add Parts - Summary

value.stringValue: Step 3/3: Finish the process or add more parts

fields.name: Screen_ProductsConsumed_CheckoutSummary_NewParts_Subheading
fields.fieldText: 1. You are about to add the following parts

fields.name: Screen_ProductsConsumed_CheckoutSummary_ActionSubheading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_ProductsConsumed_CheckoutSummary_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user select the Product Item and the desired Quantity to be consumed from the previously selected (Van-)Location and added against the previously selected WOLI/CWO.
screens.name: Screen_SelectProductItem
screens.label: Select Product Item

value.stringValue: Step 2/3: Select a part and enter the quantity consumed

fields.name: Screen_SelectProductItem_Product_Subheader
fields.fieldText: 1. Please select the part you would like to add

fields.name: Screen_SelectProductItem_Quantity_Subheader
fields.fieldText: 2. Please enter the quantity and additional notes

fields.name: Screen_SelectProductItem_Quantity_Consumed
fields.fieldText: Quantity Consumed
fields.helpText:
Instructions:


  1. Please enter the new quantity consumed without decimals.
  2. Negative values are not allowed.
  3. You can only add as many parts as are available on the truck the part has been consumed from initially (otherwise please add a part from a different van in the previous step)

validationRule.errorMessage: "Quantity Consumed" has to be greater than 0 and cannot be higher than "Quantity On Hand" for the selected part.

fields.name: Screen_SelectProductItem_Quantity_Notes
fields.fieldText: Additional Notes

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user select the appropriate (Van-) Location and - in case the Work Order triggering this flow is a Parent - a Work Order Line item to consume the parts from/to.
screens.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI
screens.label: Select Van & WOLI

value.stringValue: Step 1/3: Select a Truck & Work Order Line Item

fields.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI_Truck_Subheader
fields.fieldText: 1. Select the truck to consume parts from

fields.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI_Truck_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: Depending on your choice, in the next screen you will get only parts that are available on the selected truck in EAM/LN as well.

fields.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI_Truck_ChoiceLookup
fields.fieldText: Select the Van

fields.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI_WOLI_Subheader
fields.fieldText: 2. Select a Work Order Line Item to add parts to

fields.name: Screen_SelectVanWOLI_WOLI_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please Note: All parts have to be consumed against a Child Work Order in EAM (=WOLI or Child Work Order in Salesforce). Please select the WOLI to which you want to add parts.

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"LineItemNumber","guid":"column-55ef","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Work Order Line Item Number","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkType_ActivityCode_Name__c","guid":"column-f11c","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Work Type - Activity Code Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkType_Asset_Name__c","guid":"column-e760","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Work Type and Asset Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_EAM_Work_Order_No__c","guid":"column-f4e3","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"EAM Work Order Number","type":"text"},{"apiName":"Status","guid":"column-2c3d","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"Status","type":"text"}]

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to update the selected "Products Consumed" record.
screens.name: Screen_Update_ProductsConsumed_Error
screens.label: Update Products Consumed - Error

value.stringValue: Error: Cannot update the quantity of the selected part

fields.name: Screen_Update_ProductsConsumed_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Awww, snap! I could not update the new quantity consumed value on the selected part for you.

fields.name: Screen_Update_ProductsConsumed_ErrorDetail
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not update the quantity consumed field on the part you selected on the previous screen. If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to delete "Parts & Labour" records

﻿

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen is used as a validation screen in case the user attempts to open the feature on a work order that is already in a "completed" state. This is required as we need to prevent users from sending new Parts to EAM via the integration in case the work order in EAM might already be closed too.
screens.name: Screen_WorkOrder_Status_NotAllowed
screens.label: Work Order Status Not Allowed

value.stringValue: Error: Work Order Status not allowed
You didn't select a part to adjust on the previous screen

fields.name: Copy_1_of_Screen_AdjustSelectedParts_NoSelection_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
﻿

Awww, snap! Your Work Order {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber} is in a not allowed status "{!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.Status}".

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StatusNotAllowed_ErrorDetails
fields.fieldText:
In order to use the "Add or Adjust Parts" functionality, your work order cannot be in a closed state such as "Completed", "Canceled" or "Rejected". Reason: we cannot send additional or adjusted Parts to EAM in case the EAM Work Order might be already finance reviewed and closed too.



You can close this dialogue now.

stages.description: This element is used to define a "Stage" for the visual path component on screen elements.
stages.name: Stage_1_Overview
stages.label: Overview

stages.description: This element is used to define a "Stage" for the visual path component on screen elements.
stages.name: Stage_2_Select_Van_WorkOrder
stages.label: Select Van & Work Order

stages.description: This element is used to define a "Stage" for the visual path component on screen elements.
stages.name: Stage_3_SelectParts
stages.label: Select Parts

stages.description: This element is used to define a "Stage" for the visual path component on screen elements.
stages.name: Stage_4_Summary
stages.label: Summary

variables.description: This variable is populated automatically when the flow is openend from the Work Order triggering the flow and holds the record Id.
variables.name: recordId

variables.description: This record collection variable is used to store all Records assigned from the "var_ProductsConsumed_SingleRecord" variable prior to creating (multiple) Products Consumed records in the last step of the flow.
variables.name: var_ProductConsumed_RecordCollection

variables.description: This record variable is used to store record details of the part that has been chosen by the user to be consumed. This will then get assigned to a record collection variable prior to creation.
variables.name: var_ProductConsumed_SingleRecord
